meanings.definition: To add an umlaut to a letter or word.
meanings.sent1: She enjoys umlauting her name to give it a unique flair.
meanings.sent2: The linguist is umlauting the vowels in the text for accuracy.
meanings.sent3: After umlauting the vowels, the word looked like it belonged in a different language.
meanings.sent4: His creativity was umlauting the text, transforming it into a work of art.
meanings.sent5: The artist's skill in umlauting letters made the calligraphy mesmerizing.

meanings.definition: The act of modifying a vowel with an umlaut.
meanings.sent1: The umlauting of vowels changes the sound of the word.
meanings.sent2: In German, umlauting is a common practice to alter pronunciation.
meanings.sent3: The umlauting of vowels in the word made it sound like a different language.
meanings.sent4: Her umlauting of vowels was like adding a secret code to the text.
meanings.sent5: The beauty of umlauting lies in its ability to transform the sound of words.

meanings.definition: The process of changing the pronunciation of a vowel by adding an umlaut.
meanings.sent1: Learning about umlauting helped her understand vowel pronunciation better.
meanings.sent2: The umlauting process can be tricky for beginners to grasp.
meanings.sent3: His umlauting of vowels turned the word into a tongue twister.
meanings.sent4: The umlauting of vowels was like giving them a new musical note.
meanings.sent5: The elegance of umlauting lies in its ability to enhance vowel sounds.
